thread.title: LOOK: Vacationing Raiders players give coach Jack Del Rio some serious anxiety
thread.title_full: LOOK: Vacationing Raiders players give coach Jack Del Rio some serious anxiety

author: John Breech
title: LOOK: Vacationing Raiders players give coach Jack Del Rio some serious anxiety
text:
37m ago ‚Ä¢ 1 min read 
When Patriots coach Bill Belichick started yelling about ‚ÄúNo days off‚Äù at the Patriots‚Äô Super Bowl parade in early February, it‚Äôs very possible that he was doing it to show camaraderie with his other NFL coaches, who apparently get no days off. 
For instance, take Raiders coach Jack Del Rio. The guy is just trying to enjoy his offseason, but he can‚Äôt do that because he‚Äôs basically suffering an anxiety attack after watching three of his players trying to enjoy some extreme sports in New Zealand. 
Left guard Kelechi Osemele , running back Taiwan Jones and defensive back Brynden Trawick are all currently on vacation together, where they‚Äôre basically participating in every extreme sport they can find. 
White water rafting? Check. ‚Äî Kelechi Osemele (@KOseven0) February 20, 2017 
Doing backflips off the highest swing in the world? Check. A post shared by Kelechi Osemele (@k.o.seven0) on Feb 20, 2017 at 2:04pm PST 
Del Rio has seen these videos, and let‚Äôs just say, they‚Äôre making him a little nervous. Anxiety level went up a bit thinking of my BIG pro bowl LG on the rapids!!üò® #ReturnToWork üòé https://t.co/8IV0P8PoLy ‚Äî Jack Del Rio (@coachdelrio) February 20, 2017 
That being said, Del Rio wants his players to enjoy themselves, so he also offered some fatherly advice: Have fun and be safe. Can't leave out Brynden or Taiwan either ... have fun and be safe https://t.co/0ht7mwuUkd ‚Äî Jack Del Rio (@coachdelrio) February 20, 2017 
It‚Äôs a good thing Belichick isn‚Äôt on social media, because I‚Äôm not sure his tweets would‚Äôve been safe for small children after Tom Brady released that video of his ski wreck earlier this week.
